intro: Discopleura capillacea, commonly known as the silky discopleura, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, hairy leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
